data.title: Film Openings and Film Series Listings
data.text:
Opening This Week

"ANYTHING ELSE" — Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in a romantic comedy about a young New York writer (Jason Biggs) nursing an unrequited love; Mr. Allen plays his mentor, full of romantic advice. With Stockard Channing, Danny DeVito, Jimmy Fallon and Christina Ricci. (R) (1:36) Opens Fri.

"CASA DE LOS BABYS" — American women (Maggie Gyllenhaal, Daryl Hannah, Marcia Gay Harden, Susan Lynch, Lili Taylor and Mary Steenburgen) meet in a South American guest house, all waiting for officials to approve adoptions from the local orphanage. John Sayles wrote and directed. (R) (1:35) Opens Fri.

"COLD CREEK MANOR" — Sharon Stone and Dennis Quaid star in Mike Figgis's thriller; they play a couple who find a wonderful old mansion to fix up, unaware that the house holds dark secrets. With Stephen Dorff and Juliette Lewis. (R) (1:50) Opens Fri.

"DEMONLOVER" — In Olivier Assayas's thriller, a ruthlessly ambitious woman (Connie Nielsen) tries to undermine a multinational conglomerate. With Charles Berling, Gina Gershon and Chloë Sevigny. In English and French, with subtitles. (No rating) (2:00) Landmark's Sunshine Cinema, 139-143 E. Houston St. (212) 777-3456. Opens Fri.

"EMERALD COWBOY" — Andrew Molina's film is based on the true story of Eishy Hayata, a Japanese man who moved to Colombia to become an international jewel trader. In Spanish and English, with subtitles. (No rating) (1:57) Opens Fri.

"THE FIGHTING TEMPTATIONS" — A New York advertising executive (Cuba Gooding Jr.) travels to Georgia in order to collect an inheritance, only to learn that the terms of the will dictate that he must form a gospel choir and make it successful. Jonathan Lynn directed the comedy; with Beyoncé Knowles and LaTanya Richardson. (PG-13) (2:03) Opens Fri.
